overview:
Joy Thomas brings two decades of experience on applying Information Theory to problems in data mining, text classification, data compression, performance analysis, and network capacity.

Joy served as Chief Scientist at Iron Mountain Digital from its founding as Stratify in 1999 to its acquisition by Autonomy (HP) in 2011. He led the development of advanced mining, clustering and classification algorithms that formed the basis of the Stratify Legal Discovery Service. From 1990 to 1999, he was a Research Staff Member at the IBM T.J. Watson Research Center where his algorithmic contributions led to IBMs MXT memory doubling technology. He has been an adjunct professor at Columbia University and Stanford University.
